Battery to Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Case was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 4 days were granted.  Transfer allowed to Dane County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with Olympia Resort and victim/officer listed in the criminal complaint.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Ryan D Case in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Defendant previously entered a guilty plea to count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Rothstein makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant sentenced to the following.

COUNT #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

200 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 4 days)	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO DANE COUNTY***

TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO DANE COUNTY***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Olympia Resort and victim/officer listed in the Criminal Complaint.

COSTS:  $243.00 + $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
 
CONDITION TIME: 9 days, straight time, which will be served as follows:
-June 2, 2016 at 6:00 pm to June 5, 2016 at 6:00 pm.
-June 9, 2016 at 6:00 pm to June 12, 2016 at 6:00 pm
-June 16, 2016 at 6:00 pm to June 19, 2016 at 6:00 pm

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Received May 23, 2016, dated May 23, 2016 from Atty Gregory Rothstein,
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan D Case in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Attorney Rothstein acknowledges receipt.  Defendant pleades guilty to the amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
